documentation.text:
Factory of Proxies to the CustomSmartWallet (Forwarder)
The Forwarder itself is a Template with portions delegated to a custom logic (it is also a proxy)

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string (contains invalid UTF-8 sequence at position 3)

documentation.text:
@param forwarderTemplate It implements all the payment and execution needs,
 it pays for the deployment during initialization, and it pays for the transaction
 execution on each execute() call.
 It also acts a a proxy to a logic contract. Any unrecognized function will be forwarded to this custom logic (if it exists)

attributes.type: function (struct IForwarder.DeployRequest memory,bytes32) pure returns (bytes memory)

params.forwarderTemplate: It implements all the payment and execution needs, it pays for the deployment during initialization, and it pays for the transaction execution on each execute() call. It also acts a a proxy to a logic contract. Any unrecognized function will be forwarded to this custom logic (if it exists)

params.index: - Allows to create many addresses for the same owner|recoverer|logic|initParams
params.initParamsHash: - If there's a custom logic, these are the params to call initialize(bytes) (function sig must not be included). Only the hash value is passed
params.logic: - Custom logic to use in the smart wallet (address(0) if no extra logic needed)
params.owner: - EOA of the owner of the smart wallet
params.recoverer: - Address of that can be used by some contracts to give specific roles to the caller (e.g, a recoverer)

getSmartWalletAddress(address,address,ad.notice: Calculates the Smart Wallet address for an owner EOA, wallet logic, and specific initialization params
